review: I feel obliged to report that a further trip here was entirely satisfactory, service and food all very good. Somehow the 2 for $20 scheme ended up with me paying out $60 but that's the way it goes!

We had a group of 5 go in today for lunch. We got a table in the bar. Their was one other table with 2 guest. We all ordered lunch combos  that include your choice of soup or salad and your entree. Three of us ordered soup and the other two ordered salad. The soups were brought to the table and ranch dressing was also delivered. We waited and waited, until I flagged down our server and asked about our salads. I guess he forgot. So he brings out one salad when we ordered 2. He goes back and gets mine. Before I could take 2 bits, he is back with our entrees. I have to set my entree on a empty table next to us because there is no room at our table. I ask him to take it back because it will be cold by the time I finish my salad. He tells me he will keep it under the hot lamp. Wrong statement. I have been a GM in the restaurant industry for years and that's the last thing you tell a guest. Will not go back

Almost a year ago, we ate there for Mother's Day. Linda Davis, the manager at the time, helped us in a very embarrassing situation.  My three year old projectile vomited without warning as our meal was being served. Linda quickly responded. She had our table cleaned and our food packed up to go home in minutes without blinking an eye. It was such an embarrassing moment but she was cool and calm and made our exit very easy (especially on Mother's Day). She also gave us coupons for our next visit. Thank you so much Linda Davis.

Okay, so it's a Chili's, right?  Right.  What you see is what you get. I generally love Chili's.  It's one of the only chain-type places like this that I love no matter what. However?  This location is just a bit off.  It's never awful, but it's just not as good as most Chili's I've been to.  Given the preference, I'd rather go to the Oceanside location.  They have better service and I know the food will always be the same great taste that I come to expect.

While the staff at this location is usually on point and friendly, the fact the food is so horrific is the reason why I give it 2 stars. The only reason you should ever go to chili's is to drink and pick up on cougars. Or if you have an unhealthy obsession with Salt, as all of there food is EXTREMELY salty.

I'm done going to this Chili's. I've had slow service on and off here, but the last straw was a terrible "to go" experience. The order was supposed to be ready in 20 minutes. I arrived to pick it up and waited another 40 minutes along with about 5 other unhappy customers.  Did the manager ever show his face? No. He left some poor teeneage-looking employee to deal with a bunch of unhappy adults. I felt sorry for the kid -- it wasn't his fault. When I got home, all the food was cold. Goodbye Chili's Encinitas! It was nice knowing you.

I think I am done with this place - Its always hit and miss . Service is slow - food comes out cold about half the time - Kitchen always slow . I wont bother to return again , been disappointed too many times now and why bother if they don't!
it's another chili's. i'm a teen and i can't afford this shit but it's decent food, sometimes speedy service, and i don't have much to complain about. i always draw on the kids menus.
Add me to the slow "to go" service.  My food was delivered 50% longer than it was estimated to be and it was not very warm when I got home.

From what I have experienced this Chili's isn't in any way better or worse than any other Chili's.  The people that work here are friendly and seem to be doing their job just like any other Chili's I've been to.  Go here only about once every 6 months when I'm on that side of town.  Never ordered take out before.

Nice menu and great food! Love the Enchilada soup and their hot wings! The staff is nice and friendly here. It is kind of loud at times. It is best to go before 6pm. If you have a group of friends and want a spicey food choice, this has great selections! The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because of the noise. Not a relaxing place to go. It is a SPORTS BAR atmosphere even in the restaurant.
Every Chili's I got to always has nice servers, friendly, funny, fast, smiling. Love the 35 dollar deal, two margaritas, one appetizer, two entrees and a one desert

What can you say about Chilis?  You know what to expect 9 times out of 10.  The food is decent for a good price.  At this particular one the staff seems to love being with each other because they were all having a party in the back, but not too many of them actually serving tables.  The servers were very nice, but just more interested in hanging out in the kitchen. My favorite food here is the jalapeno bacon burger.  Hands down I've yet to eat a better burger anywhere.  I know you're thinking at chili's? really???  Yes!  If you want an awesome burger its here.  Get a side of ranch and you won't be disappointed.

Definitely gone way yay downhill.  Ordered the chicken fajitas which were microwaved.  Tortillas were so nuked they stuck together and were hard when exposed to air. Service was also as good as the food.  Finally found someone to get water after dry tortillas and all served with attitude.  Been coming for years but this may have been the last time.  Think about it.  A chain that is less than half full at dinner time near the beach.  No more waiting here.

Chili' s is your typical crap food corporate restaurant. There are like 5 "healthy" items on the menu. This was a food  emergency or I wouldn't have gone. Worse than I expected. If I want decent grilled foods I'd definitely go somewhere us. Our first server sat us,  took a drink & appetizer order and left.....never came back! Thankfully we grabbed a really nice and helpful server after 10 min of waiting and she took great care of us. Just not crazy about the food.

I really like Chili's, we have one in Escondido which my wife and I visit regularly. When I visited this Chili's in Encinitas on the way home from a pregnancy class at the hospital, I learned quickly that not all Chili's are created equal. Here are the problems I had with this location. When we arrived, it was not busy. It was a Wednesday night around 9:30pm. We stood at the front area for a little over 5 minutes before anyone noticed us. There was no hostess at the door to welcome us and no other patrons waiting in front of us. After looking around for a bit looking for someone to seat us, a waitress finally saw us and sat us down next to a table of high school kids, ugh. My wife is 7 1/2 months pregnant at this time and there were a ton of tables, why one right next to a bunch of loud kids... One of the kids stole one of the other kids shoe and left the shoe sitting in our bench seat. My wife grabbed it and returned it to him... seems like some the waitress or hostess could have handled, but oh well. The kids had a friend working there that ended up being our waitress, she was over there chatting a bunch with them, but still did a good job of checking up on her tables. The one plus of the evening.  We ordered the pretzels for an appetizers, they came out a little burnt and we were never given silverware sets. I had to track down our waitress to get us some silverware.  I ordered a tap beer, it came with a piece of a tortilla chip in it. I ordered a Southwestern Chicken Pizza for my entree, I get it at my local Chili's often and it's delicious. My pizza came out on time with my wife's food, but our waitress accidentally dropped the entire pizza face down on the ground when serving it to me. Ugh. By the time the new one was made, my wife was finished with her meal. Even worse, when the new one came, it was under cooked. The dough was raw and in some places there were parts of the pizza where the cheese wasn't even melted! My frozen pizza's at home have never even had a problem with not melting the cheese... I told the waitress about it and she offered to make me a new one, but it was already getting way too late, my wife already finished her meal and was waiting on me and we were both getting tired. I was hoping she would comp it, but I got charged the full amount for the pizza.  We caught a glimpse of the Manager, seemed very laid back, did not care what the staff was doing. I think a lot of these issues trace back to bad management.  In summary, not all Chili's are created equal. Avoid this one if you can, we have no plans on ever returning to this location.

The family and I have beef to several Chili's in the past and generally have had a decent meal. Kids like it and usually we can find something safe. This Chili's is the exception to that rule. Food was really bad, we had Fajita Trio which is normally pretty good. It was awful here. The chicken was microwaved or steamed and soggy. The steak was almost like beef jerky and the onions and peppers were a soggy tasteless mess. Our kids shared a trio appetizer and fries which they said was ok.

WHAT HAPPENED?? This place SUKS.  The food cold, the staff unreasonable....Charging me for items normally free, then I had to SHAME them into taking off my bill.  DO NOT go to Chilis in Encinitas.  There is a new place across the street, I am going to rtry that and see if they actually APPRECIATE me.  I will NEVER go to Chilis in Encinitas AGAIN.
Had a gift card in my purse for over a year!  Glad mom and I are getting a chance to use it!  Just your average Chili experience!

The hubby and I went there last went here last Thursday.  Their tabletop ordering systems are making the wait staff WAY less attentive to the customers.  Our waiter seemed to avoid making eye contact with us.  And, while this is off the subject, he was drenched in cologne (I'm allergic).  I was sent a coupon by Chili's to get us in there.....it took way too long for someone to figure out how to credit it to the bill......the food was good, but the service is terrible.  Maybe it's just this one, I don't know....but there are so many competing restaurant choices in that area, going there is not worth the drama to us. EDIT:  11/12/13: The hubby wrote to customer service at Chili's.  They told us that they don't own this Chili's, it's a franchise.  I'm guessing that how their brand is projected to the market doesn't really matter, if they're hiding behind the "franchise" statement.  They don't get it.  Too bad.

First off, I'm a former "chili head", having worked in two different locations years ago. I've always been a fan, as they typically deliver for a corporate chain.  Well, no more.  It's been years since I walked away pleased with the experience on every level. Last week was no different.  We were greeted by the very friendly manager which was a plus, but it was down hill from there.  I will say my entree (the chicken mango dish on the healthy menu) was pretty good.  The boneless wings were dreadful. The issues were primarily with the service.  Very slow for one, then when the food was finally deliver, half the table got their entrees nearly 10 minutes before the others, though they were "coming right out".     NEVER in all my years of eating in restaurants and being a food server have I ordered iced tea and received a mug of room temp tea minus the ice, lemon, straw.  I HAD TO ASK for these things.  For some reason this was the most unacceptable thing of all.   BTW it was dead when we were there for lunch so there was NO reason for service to be lacking.  Such a disappointment.  At least they have the new electronic gadgets on the tables now so you don't have to wait for the bill to be delivered.  I would say from now on I'll just go to Island's but they are just as bad, at least in Encinitas.  Oh and I attempted to e-mail Chili's my feedback directly but there was NO "contact us" anywhere on the website or promotional e-mails that I could find, that went directly to the Encinitas site, so here I yelp...

We go in to order a dessert and flatbread to go.  We are told it is going to be 20 min. 40 min later I ask about our order and one guy goes back to check.  Another guy comes walking out from the kitchen area with our order in a bag.  I ask him was it sitting back there on the counter?  He says no it just came out.  Interesting since the flatbread was lukewarm.  A manager comes out and apologizes and asks if we want another order.  I tell her no way I am waiting again.  She apologizes more.  After I tell her it's ridiculous to wait 40 min for ice cream and flatbread she apologizes again.  I tell her to Just give me my money back.  She says ok no problem.  Then the waiter offers us to go ahead and take the dessert.  That's fine and dandy but why would you not offer the flatbread too?   Terrible customer service.  This is for the Encinitas restaurant.

came here again after a long time. order the quesadilla salad. when the waitress was transferring it from her tray to our table (with her bare hands), one of the quesadilla pieces fell on the tray. i told her we didn't want it. her response? oh, we wash these trays everyday..its okay.  grosssss! i told her we still didn't want it. why did she continue to pester me? finallyyyyy, she did what i felt was appropriate and brought a fresh slice out

Came in to have dinner with my husband and son one night and did not enjoy anything whatsoever. Normally a fan of Chili's but there was something off about this one. The food was terrible. The chips for the salsa was sooooo salty. Couldn't eat any of it and that's the reason I come. My son had chicken fingers and fries and how do you mess up on that right? He took one bite of the chicken and had to spit it out. The fries were extra salty as well. Our server was really nice but extremely slow for having only one table (it was just us and another group in the whole restaurant and there was another sever taking care of the other group) My husband ordered a beer and we just saw it sitting there at the bar, melting away. Until he finally had enough and had to ask the manager whom was sweeping the booth next to us to grab it. She was more than happy to do so. $80 for some froZen bag bad food. Left feeling unsatisfied and robbed of our $80 bucks.

It's Chilis folks! Who can't go for a modestly priced baby back rib...I want my baby back baby back.. Delicious and convenient, the Chilis in Encinitas fulfills our areas national chain restaurant quota as well as any of the other usual suspects would. Most importantly I can walk there from home. Enjoy!

My son loves this place because of their tablet and their games and I had a gift card so what a better combo.  I googled the nearest location and this place came up.  It wasn't so easy to find because it's a shopping center so i had to drive around a bit to finally find it.  There was hardly anyone there so we were seated right away.  There was only one server in our area but she was quick and brought out everything pretty fast.  I ordered fajitas for both my son and I, i had the shrimp, chicken and carnitas and my son had the steak and chicken.  The chicken was tasty but the steak was gross.  The carnitas were nothing but fat so i didn't eat those and it's a good thing i ordered an appetizer because otherwise we would have left the place hungry.  I only had to pay $3 bucks out of my pocket so although the food wasn't all that... i didn't get to pay for it.  :)

Pretty decent happy hour prices and not too crowded. Got to watch some hockey while we sipped margaritas and has their yummy chips and salsa. It's not a fancy place or a go to place of mine by any means but it hit the spot tonight. Great service too!!
Anyone experience any stomach problems after eating at Encinitas Chili's

Came back with the extended family, 7 of us plus infant on 5/11.  Was a great experience.  Table service by Jeremy was wonderful, and he kept us fueled in all respects.  We enjoyed a myriad of typical Chili fair and really don't have any complaints about this place.  Perhaps a better alcohol pour on their mixed drinks, but really all-in-all a great time.

We have had the pleasure a couple of times to get take out at this location and it has been delicious!  We had a little trouble with the online ordering so, we called the order in and the person who took our order was extremely nice and very helpful.  When we picked up our order the people who took care of us did a great job too.  I have rated this a 5 because great customer service is a big deal to us and it seems nowadays very hard to come by. We look forward to the next time we will be up here and have the opportunity to eat here again.

Service was lacking. Food was good as typical of a chili restaurant however the experience was ruined by lack of attention.  The table was dirty and after the hostess said she would wipe it down no one arrived so our waiter used a napkin. Not a location we will be visiting again.

Came on a Wednesday evening at 6:30 and walked in to a half full restaurant. The hostess came over after a minute and put us on a list to wait for 15-20 minutes. Noticed that there were 3-4 groups waiting for a table as well. Waited the 20 minutes and then an additional 10 minutes before a server came over to our table so obviously understaffed.   Come on Chili's! How can you be so understaffed or so poorly run as to make customers wait when there are plenty of free tables?  The food's not that great... you guys gotta at least have fast, good service.

Walked in at 7pm on a slow Tues night with my 16 & 9 year old. Hostess says umm let me see what I have. Crickets as we look around. She leaves for a minute then sits us. My 9 year old has to go back & ask her for a kids menu. It was a while before we saw a waiter. Nice guy, but definitely did not go above & beyond especially when I couldn't decide. I've been a server before, make some suggestions! Food was ok. Everything was just so slow, especially coming with our check & never even asked if we wanted dessert. My 16 year old said I don't want to come back here. Enough said!!

3 different servers before we even ordered anything. That was confusing. I had the mixed trio of fajitas. Looked fantastic but tasted greasy. I had a horrible taste of greasy onions in the mouth afterwards. Something was off about it. The tortilla chips were really good. Nicely salted and light. Our 3rd server forgot my partners mash potatoes. Not the best service. She failed to come back to our table to see if we needed anything else. Maybe she thought ziosk would ask us instead! I like the ziosk tablet idea, but it charged us $.99 for a game we didn't even play and be careful because the default tip on the inbuilt payment device is 20%. Cheeky buggers!! Pay more attention to the service and food and less about charging customers for ways to make money from games one doesn't even play!

I was a little annoyed with my service last night at the bar. It started when I asked Tamera if she could make a margarita without sweet and sour but with fresh lime juice. She polity said she can but it will be very limey. I took a second to think, leaning toward just having a beer. She had said something about if you are looking for a "skinny margarita I got it" and walked away. Ok. She made a margarita. I watched her do it...everything looked ok, until she put something I didn't recognize in it. I asked "what was the last thing"...it was sweet and sour. Now, firstly I am not on a diet, I didn't want a skinny margarita. I actually am VERY allergic to artificial sweetener. In my experience any "mix" has some sort of sweetener. She had said it has Agave. I had no way of knowing if their "agave" was true pure agave or agave essence or what. So I politely took the drink, and took a sip. It wasn't good taste wise. It was very limey. I asked for some OJ. That made it tolerable. But I couldn't get the idea that there might be something that will make me sick in it...so I gave it to my husband and asked for a beer.  She said she would take it, but I said its ok he will drink it. This is where I could see her getting annoyed. I don't know what else I could have done to be MORE polite about rejecting the drink.  After that the service just went down hill. We ordered food and that came out fine but she didn't want anything else to do with us. I had to flag her down for a side of ranch. She didn't clear our plates or bring the bill until we put our card on the bar. At which time she took it to her register without a word. Brought it back and asked if we needed a box, I said yes. She ran a box by and didn't say anything. No, thank you for coming in. No, have a great night. Nothing. Threw the box in my direction and walked away. At that point I was annoyed and said "Thanks a lot!!" I don't know how someone just assumes that because I ask for a drink without mix that I am on a diet. I mean I ate a pizza, texas fries, and burger bites lol. And then to ask for a drink, very clearly "without mix" but to go ahead an put some in there anyway?? and then give me attitude when I ask for something else. Ps. I make margaritas all the time without mix and they are amazing...not sure why it was so hard for a bartender to make one. Ya know, to top it off the bartender charged us for the drink. Now I know my husband drank it...but I have worked at many restaurants. In fact worked at a chilis the entire time I was in college...and when a customer doesn't like something, its polite to take it off the bill. Even if they drink it. While that was the least offensive part of the night it was a funny little cherry on top.  Can't say I'll be back to this location. The food was great though...always is. I'll just stick to the Vista store.

Went there the other day,there was not a crowd there, or a hostess,waited for a bit still no one to seat us I wish these kids would learn something about customer service  finally walked out, to bad, love thier burgers.

So we go to the neighborhood eatery. A relatively busy Friday night. Admittedly the service here is slower than any other one we have been to. We order. i get my beer and as we are waiting for our meal the waiter comes ans says. " I don't want to rush you but I'm leaving and you will have a new waitor. Would you pay now so I can leave?" REALLY? I haven't even taken a sip of my beer! So I replied that I won't pay until I've eaten. He gives a sour look and walks away. He then proceeds to ask all of his other tables the same question. Now the food comes with beans and rice we didn't order! Worst Chili's  I've been to.

Eeew, I have a stomach ache now! I have lived in Encinitas almost 9 years and for the first time went to chili's because we had a gift card credit. Oh my, it was awful. The server was sweet and the kids liked the gaming devices, but the food was NO BUENO! $10 for a small-ish chicken caesar salad with fake-ish chicken. $20 ribs that had NO meat on them! The kids were still hungry after their meals. It was a bust. Sorry, but I cannot go back EVER.

The ONLY reason why I don't give this place 5 stars is because their menu is so accommodating that the flavors lack. But what else do you expect from a huge chain like this??  This is my go to place, especially on Sunday's for their all day happy hour!!! I loveeeee their happy hour. They offer beer and margarita specials. My favorite it the presidente for happy hour. It's 5.99 but amazing!!! The 4.50 hour margarita is weakkkk. Spend the extra money and have a good time! Other than the drink specials they have awesome different priced appetizer specials.  I think this place is completely underrated restaurant! There menu is extensive with amazing deals for two and mix and match combos.  They also offer very easy curbside pick up Togo orders. I've ordered food to pick up NUMEROUS times. And my food is always fresh, warm, and ready to go at the exact time they tell me.

Wow worst chili's EVER! They served me a steak that was not edible,  after I complained they offered to make another one. And as if it was possible the next steak was worst than the first one. Lol so I asked to speak to a manager,  who seemed nice until he kept saying "yes you already said that! I heard you and we have no control over the quality of steak we serve" REALLY?? TELLING THE CUSTOMER BE QUITE, YOU ALREADY SAID THAT? after I waited patiently then you tell me we have no control over serving gross food! Horrible customer service.  And I will never eat here again

I had the quesadilla explosion salad at lunch today, and it was pretty good. The actual salad was great, the quesadilla was a little bit of a let down, but not horrible...just not on par with the quality of the salad. The server was very friendly, as was the hostess. The tables and surrounding area were clean too. Nothing incredibly memorable about the actual restaurant, but it was honestly the PERFECT spot for our working lunch.

IMO the best any chilis/Applebee's/Tigi Fridays can do is three stars. Average menu, average food, average service, long waits on he weekends.  You go for consistency because the product is the same everytime, at every location.  I honestly haven't been to a chilis in over 2 years but Came in the other night to meet some friends for dessert. Dessert (specifically the molten cake) and endless chips and salsa are the best things on the menu. Other than that, eh.  This night our server was really good and kept our drinks full and didn't mind is taking up a booth in her section for a couple hours. (But it was a tues night and the restaurant wasn't busy) b
I love me some Chili's and it's awesome that they change their menu often with seasonal items. Had a great meal here and the service is always good and friendly. I'll be back soon.

The food is as you'd expect from this sort of restaurants, it's your average plasticy looking chicken, ribs looking like they were rather manufactured in some lab, and dry tasteless salads with shredded chemicals that resemble cheddar cheese ... I have no complaints about the food, I would actually give it three stars if I were just rating the food.  We went there for my sons birthday thinking the atmosphere was going to fun and exciting which was a big mistake! They have put these tablets on tables to order food or play games and so service is non existent. Servers just bring food and that's only if they don't mess up your order. I mentioned to our server two times that we were there for a little kids birthday and asked if he could blow a candle .... you'd think they would sing a birthday song or something, but no, too lazy to even do that. Then we decided to order some deserts so we asked for a candle and a cake the waiter said he gets a birthday scoop but we had already decided on the cake, they brought the cake but still not a candle so at least we could sing him happy birthday. He was pretty bummed out, we ended up going home and doing the candle thing at home. I'd give this place zero stars on service if I could!

We usually hit up Chilis every week after class. Several months ago we went in and found that they no longer offered free chips and salsa in the bar area. They never bothered to tell us, they just added it into our bill! Ok, no big deal but they should have told us when we ordered! Tonight we order a cheeseburger ( comes with fries) and the burger comes out by itself on a big plate without the fries! We are told that the fries will be out soon. What? Who brings out half of an order? 20 minutes later we ask for the fries and a waitress comes back and tells us someone took our fries and that they are making us a new batch. We will be looking for a new hangout!
I don't understand the negative reviews. I stopped by after a long day for a drink and the food, staff, and of course the few blue moons couldn't have been better.

Waited for 15 til I was acknowledged.  I even went to see if there were any tables n the bar. Yes they were busy. Tables everywhere were empty without being bussed. The hostess was clueless. She yold me to wait by a table and it will get bussed.... r u kidding me?? After 30 minutes of nothing we left. Never been happy coking to Chili... not sure why i tried again. This will be the last.

Chilis is a great little place to go if you don't know what you're in the mood for. They have a very big selection of different kinds of food. Sandwiches, burgers, salads, BBQ, fish, tacos, steak, Mexican, and much much more.  I'm updating my review because the last 2 times I came I really enjoyed it. The Caribbean salad is amazing very fresh tasting. The turkey club was great too and a lot bigger than what I thought It'll be.  I definitely want to try every type of food they have, I'm sure the majority of it will be good. I also love the Fresh Guacamole on the menu, it comes with salsa as well.   Service is always decent, not horrible not amazing.

Chilis used to be a great place to go to during Happy Hour and meals in general. But the company has become stingy and things aren't the same anymore. Happy Hour doesn't offer anything like it did before and the prices for regular meals just keeps getting higher while portions are smaller. What really got me was when I went in for the unlimited enchiladas and was told by the waitress that I could take the enchiladas home if I didn't finish and then right after I paid she comes and tells me that her manager said I can't take it anymore. If she told me upfront in the beginning it wouldn't be a surprise but she didn't tell me nor did the menu state that I couldn't take it either. The only reason I am upset by it is because it had to go to waste. Not sure if they ended up throwing it away but if an employee states that you can take it, u should honor it and not wait till after I pay to tell me I can't take it anymore. At the end of the day, it wasn't a big deal, just wasteful, I'll probably still end up coming back because there isn't a lot of choices you have for restaurants in the neighborhood :/

A family favorite: I used to not think twice about this place but now I dread it a bit, and lately it is more dreadful:  they keep reinventing themselves by using different pictures and layouts but it's the same basic ingredients.  Simple, rather plain, uninteresting presentations.  However it is always filling and not horrible.  Service is a bit slow since they are stretched even when the place isn't very full.  Every year I go it seems more like an old diner.

They suck here now. Unbelievable! Half the restaurant was abandoned literally, however there was a "wait" until the full side of the restaurant was done eating. I asked to talk to the manager, he didn't come by, so we left. Several more families came in wanting to give their money, but they were also rejected. We will never come to this location, until it becomes a different restaurant when Chili's goes out of business in a few months.

I used to go to this chilis at least once a week during football season least year with my colleagues.  The happy hour was extended through the football games which included free chips and salsa, discounted beers and a happy hour menu.  Now, during the games its a 'modified' happy hour with only budlight on discount, no free chips and salsa and only a couple happy hour menu items.  I don't want to make it seem like I was just there for the free chips.  We would order a couple (tall) beers each plus food, often times off the regular menu and we would tip well.  Now that they changed the happy hour I've only been once.  I feel like the service declined too... they added those stupid 'iPad' waiter things to order from so it's not a personal experience anymore.  The food is still okay, that hasn't changed.   It just sucks they had to change the happy hour.  I don't know if it was to save them a few pennies on the dollar for the free chips (which, let's be honest, probably costs them less than a buck) or they are adapting the "why give something away for free if they will pay for it" model.  Either way... this is no longer my MNF and TNF place to go to watch the games after work.

First, it's Chiles okay. They're great for a chain restaurant. They take forever for lunch though so if you're on a time limit don't come here. Is it a five start restaurant? No. Are they super special? No.  It's a good place to get together and eat.

Tamra our Server was very friendly and always ready to give us refills but not overbearing. Cool ambience. We ordered the mix and match fajitas and it was excellent. She recommended that we go with the trio for 50 cents more so we did.We even got dessert!

We have eaten here several times. But the fish tacos were terrible today .  The fish had a fishy taste, mostly cabbage in a cold taco shell.  The chili that came with it was just like warm.  The floor around our seats were dirty, trash and good on the floor.  For the price. Much better options in the area.

The hubby and I stopped in for a quick bite. The food was surprisingly good and reasonably priced- bravo to the cook!  However, we were short on time, which was great considering the waiter picked up our plates while we were still eating. He checked on our table without breaking his stride to hide out since there were maybe five other tables in the entire restaurant. I understand everyone has an "off" day and overlooking bad behavior is my strong suit, but collecting dinner plates that aren't empty yet takes rudeness to a new level.

So, apparently I have another Chili's also in my queue.  So, what I should say about one, undoubtedly applies to the other.  And with an identical menu and setup, it deserves an identical review.  With that in mind... /sigh Alright, I typically lump Chili's in with all the other places in the chain restaurant category. If you've been to one Island's (the Denny's of tacky burgers), you've been to them all. If you've eaten at one Marie Calendar's (the Denny's of fake home cooking), you eaten at them all. If you've subjected to yourself to one Rimel's (the Denny's of Denny's), you're probably lying in the ICU at the hospital with an inflamed bowel ravaged by dysentery. Well, Chili's is the Tex-Mex version of Denny's, not quite Mex enough to be an El Torito and not quite Tex enough to violate minority rights. Harmless enough, any appetizers you find are likely pre-frozen and fried up, salads will come out of a mixed bag, and most of the spice will come from salt. That's not to say the food is bad, it's just basic and unimaginative. A lot of cheese, some bacon sprinkled on top, a side of fries, and some cream based dressing can make anything edible for a night. And they serve beer, which is how they stay afloat along with happy hour, I'm sure. The employees are generally nice, though absent most of the time. I think this stems from from the fact that there are mini-computers on each table that can take orders instead of a waiter of waitress that you have to pay. We've had trips here where we see someone to make our initial order, someone else deliver, and then never see another soul unless we ask for a refill or the bill on that touch screen. That's extremely lazy (or cheap) on Chili's part and a bit of a disservice to their customers. Still, as far as chain places go, it's generally more alright than disgusting. There's nothing on the menu that you have to come back and try again, but there's rarely anything you won't push away either. Again, coated with cheese and served with blue cheese, you'll probably not complain too much. And if you stick with happy hour and maybe a dessert, you'll more than likely walk out with a smile and a light stomach ache.

Alright so Chili's is a chain restaurant, so of course don't expect it to be over the top amazing. But for really tasty food, fast service, and fun environment, I would pick Chili's over some other chain restaurants in this category. They have always had that "pick two" deal that allowed you to pick two entrees and an appetizer to share, which was always a great way to go for date night! Most recently when I went this deal was not available. However, they are having a bbq ribs deal going on right now that is pretty amazing for the price. For $10.99 you get a half rack of babyback ribs, a side salad, fries, and a small chocolate molten cake with icecream. YEAH, crazy right?! And for $6 more, you can make the half rack to a full rack. This was a lot of food and easily could be shared between two people. And for that price? PLUS dessert?! I was just so amazed. So if you're a bbq rib person, I would suggest you rush into Chili's soon before the deal is over. We also got the tableside-made guacamole for appetizer. Now living in Southern California, there are plenty of places that we could've fulfilled our guac cravings. But Chili's actually came through! You can pick what you want put in the guac and they mash the avocados right there in front of you. Lots of guac and salsa and plenty of chips.

I'm not sure what I'm supposed to review about a Chili's.  I mean, it's a Chili's -- it's a chain restaurant and you pretty much know what you are going to get.   To be totally fair, I'm not a fan of their food per se.  I once was a fan 15 years ago (though it always paled in comparison to Spoons, imo) and I'm sure they've changed it, lessened the quality, etc -- but maybe I've just outgrown it, because my kids friggin love this place and I can never figure out why.  The burgers are really yucky and I can only imagine it's because I let them pay on the little table computery thing.  I'm sure not all Chili's are equal.  This one is small and clean...and probably most importantly right next to Target.  The servers are all very nice. And the cheese fries are really really excellent.  The black bean burger is also good (never great, but if I wanted great would I really be at a Chili's?) So, taking that all into consideration and this is where you really want to eat-- go. And order the Texas fries.

I've been to another Chili's before & the experience was horrible & I swore I'd never go to another one. Well my friend somehow talked me into going to this location. Our first mistake was sitting in the bar area to have our dinner but there's where they sat us. It took 10 minutes before anyone took our drink order, then it took another 10 minutes before our sodas were served to us. We placed our order which we started with an appetizer, that took another 10-15 minutes to get to us, we needed refills & no one ever came until we flagged someone down. Our server wasn't transparent at all & we had to ask twice to have her come out. After sitting & waiting for 20 minutes we asked to have our server come out once again. We decided to get our meals to go because the the service was so bad & the 12 people that were there were screaming at the game on the TV. This was my second horrible experience with Chili's & my last, I will never go to another one & no one will be able to talk me into it.  Oh & what is it with those stupid order systems on the tables, is that why the service sucks?
Never had a bad experience here. I come in often and all the servers are very nice and friendly. Would reccomend. The food tastes great as well!

SCOTT WAS AMAZING. What great service! We took my grandmother out for lunch today. We weren't expecting much based on the current Yelp rating... But from the moment we walked in, we received top notch service and food. The food was what could be expected from a chili's. Good but not gourmet. The service, on the other hand, was impeccable. We never had to ask for a refill or for anything to be cleared from the table. Scott was masterful. Next time I am in town, I will definitely bring her back. She had a FABULOUS time!
Scott was our server and he was wonderful. The food was good, the place was clean, no waiting, and the best service in town! Thanks Scott!

Let me start off by saying that I really enjoy dinning at Chilies. This was my first time coming to Chilies in Encinitas and it will be my last time. Ordered wings and beer. The beer came out in a broken glass and the wings were burn to a crisp. I spoke with the waitress and they got me another beer and I ordered something different. My problem is that the manager didn't even come over to say sorry or try to make my dinning experience any better. This happened Wednesday June 29th for happy hour. I'm assuming that this staff must have be the D team.  Don't wast your time coming here for happy hour. There's plenty of other restaurants in this area that have better service.

I love Chilis and it's probably my favorite American grill chain, but this location kinda sucks and that's unfortunate because I live in the neighborhood. Good deals and good food, but the service is totally sub par, even comparing just to other Chilis.  My last visit here, our server was MIA for awhile and another server ended up taking our drink orders. We finally ordered food, then the server came back and told my husband that one of the menu options was no longer available. Ok. So he picked another and asked for the sides available and made it work. Then she came back and said they had no ceasar salads (something I assume she should have known right off the bat), so he switch to Italian house. When our salads came out, his was served with a side of oil and a side of vinegar. Okay, I get those are the main components of Italian dressing but again, I telling him it wasn't an option (and providing the actual options) would have been the correct service.  When our food came out, it looked off. I had ribs and a side of skillet mashed potatoes because that's what my server told me came with it. The ribs looked lonely all by them self on the plate. Seems like a weird dish. I made no alterations or swaps so not sure what's going on there. My husbands steak came out with a side of asparagus and mashed potatoes and we ended up getting charged extra. Again, his intention was just to order the standard menu item.  It became clear that our server had no familiarity with the menu and Chilis food, something that should be mastered before taking orders.

We were staying at the Park Hyatt, checking out the surrounding areas. Nice place to stop for lunch. We had the 3 for 10 deal, "great deal". The fries were tasty, I had the bacon burger , it was great. The pound cake topped off the lunch. Nice atmosphere, laid back. Had a super time with the Mrs. Wayne took great care of our needs.

Extremely underwhelming at this location. I find myself at a loss for words as I am utterly disappointed on almost every aspect of this restaurant. I work in food service so it doesn't take much to blow my socks off and want to give my waiter a large tip - I just want attentive service, friendly personalities, and good food. That isn't much to ask for. Well unfortunately, Chili's was 0/3. My server looked like they did not want to be there and did not want to work. My beer was empty for some time before I was offered another one, which I declined because it took forever. My daughters drink was empty for some time too, however, I decided to just find the water pitcher and fill it up myself.  The chips were great as always, it's hard to mess those up. My meal was horrible. I definitely got the bottom of the barrel of whatever I ordered and it was repulsive. Perhaps I'm being overly critical of my experience but there seemed to be a lack of any type of motivation here.  Chili's... hire people who actually want to work. It's unfortunate that you have a two and a half star overall rating.... listen to the people! I know its common for yelpers to only chime in about negative experiences but goodness, you need an overhaul!

Worst restaurant ive been to in along time went from nice friendly family place to preppy pertinacious rude rude rude rude i sat in the bar ordered medium burger got extra well done wen tryd to send back tool 5 mins and was told ok um so wat do u want me to do aviod this establishment at all costs

I live close by and we come here often. I recommend joining their reward program as we frequently get free deserts and non-alcoholic drinks. Also the emails reminding you of low price margaritas work well in terms of convincing us to visit after work. Their 2 for $22 deals are the value choice here with the 2 salads or Texas cheese fries being their best options for the appetizer. For entrees, the steak and chicken fajitas are our favorites. The on tap beers are also good with Ballast Points Sculpin being our favorite. Tip: call ahead to get on the wait list during busy times such as Friday night.

How is this location still in business? We left because the host took almost 10 minutes to greet us and offer a table. When the host came, we told him we had a group of 7 and he said he was going to need to split our group. The place was almost empty and half of the restaurant is close because they don't have enough staff. I am glad we left and didn't eat there.

The food was mediocre but the worst part was the waitress Cheyenne who had a horrible attitude, I've never seen anything like it... No smile, acted like we were an inconvenience, took our order then was nowhere to be found; we had to ask for another waitress to help us, she had the best attitude ever, although in training she acted like she knew what she was doing & had the most beautiful smile, I believe her name is Amber; she's the only reason I'm giving this restaurant 2 stars. Being that the food was mediocre and the service (except for Amber) deserves zero stars, I would never go back again...

Love this place to have dinner with the kids and the family. The menu has new items on a regular basis that are fun to try. The only issue is the wait to get the food, it can be a bit long. We will still come back bcse it is great value for the money when eating with kids.

Every time I come here I order on the phone for a pick up and walk in. Wait forever at the take out table and people are just rushing around and it's not even busy. I ask for help and no one pays attention then they give me attitude that I have a problem. I work right around the corner and other co workers complain about the service

One word: 'Merica!  Nothing beats your local Chili's on a Friday night.  If you question this, I might question your patriotism good sir (or ma'am).  If you have anything less than five-star opinions of this place please keep your subversive views to yourself or you might end up on a blacklist.  Haha, jk but seriously you know what you're getting when you come here, why such relatively mediocre reviews?
Place is half empty and they can't sit a party of 5 , really!?!? Host said she waiting for tables to open.  ITS HALF EMTPY!!!!

So I have a taste for ribs.  I notice they commented on my post asking me to reach out to them.  I just did with apprehension if it will be the same thing.  However, I'm now scrolling through the various reviews.  I'm in shock as to how many bad reviews there are.  It's a damn shame because their ribs (used) to be/are good.  But I guess if you can't take an order correctly, what's the use.  And the really sad thing is who's better?  Famous Dave's closed.  They were consistent.  Phil's ribs have gone downhill and Bret's are dry.  Woe is me.  Must I make my own, LOL?

Yet another horrible experience at this Chilis location. 50 minutes from time we were seated to get our food, which wasn't good. Baked Potato soup tasted like melted cheddar cheese. My wife's mango margarita was bitter. To finish, we had a molten lava cake - which had ice crystals in the ice cream.  Kids meal came out last! Cold French fries, soggy bread. Their replacement for their cheese sticks is awful!!!  Every time I think this Chilis location couldn't be any worse, it is. I'm putting a note on my phone to remind m every time we want to go there, to pick somewhere else instead.

Been coming here for years now with a bunch of my friends for a get together. The service and food is always great. They change there menu a good amount and you can choose different items when you come. They have a full bar service and the restaurant is good size as well.

Chips and salsa are actually pretty darn good here.  I got a presidente margarita too which was very yummy. We always sit in the bar area and the bar service is much better than the dining area. Good place for a quick drink and snack

We've gone here for years and always had an ok experience until today.  The waitress, Rachel, came to our table with obvious attitude.  My husband tried to joke with her and ordered a margarita and said, tell the bartender not to be "shy" when he pours the tequila". She immediately bristled and said I can't say that and rolled her eyes in disgust even though he said he was kidding.  We ordered without her saying hardly a word or acknowledging she understood our order, and with a nasty look on her face.  She just kept rolling her eyes.  After she left the table my husband said quietly to me, I don't like her attitude and it's annoying to have to pay to get treated like that. He went to the bathroom and the manager, Kyle, came over and said is everything ok.  I said yes.  He became very rude and arrogant and said the waitress said your husband asked for a big pour and told her he didn't like her.  I said that didn't happen and proceeded to relate the accurate account.  He said well I'm asking you to be kind to her.  I said we were very nice and even tried to joke with her but we noticed her attitude from the moment we sat down and perhaps she should be encouraged to be friendly to the customers and he left in a huff.  When my husband returned I relayed what happened and we agreed to leave as we don't need to pay to be aggravated when there are lots of restaurants that actually have great service and food.  The manager came up to my husband and began yelling loudly in front of everyone.  My husband said you have no right to talk like that to my wife so aggressively and rudely when she had nothing to do with it.  You purposely waited until I was gone to do so.  The manager began screaming and causing a big scene as we were leaving.  My husband said we've been coming here for years but will never come back when you're here.  The manager yelled you don't have to ever come back - I don't care.  The other patrons were in shock. So if you'd like to have rude service and an out of control manager, this is your place.  Suggest you find someplace that actually wants and appreciates customers.
This place is dirty... The floors from the dining room to the kitchen to the bathrooms are disgusting.

Please upgrade your toilet paper.   Lord, I've used toilet paper that was softer in a gas station crossing the desert.  While you're at it, you might want to update your paper towel rolls: so they work.

We always go to this Chilis every year for our annual trip to moonlight beach. Tonight the service was fast and efficient . We also ordered an extra entree to go for a family member who couldn't join us and it was brought to us right before we left. Food was very good and fresh.
The best chicken and waffles that I have ever had. The waffle was sweet and the chicken was so crispy. Amazing margaritas too!!!

5+ HUGE stars for Mark and the awesome service he provides us! We are always so happy to see his bright smile and happy demeanor! He always takes such good care of us! It's always a good time when we stop into Chili's. My go to is the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich! Their lunch specials are fabulous, and a LOT of food! This is our favorite Chili's by far!
Really like Mark he is always very gracious and knows what we like. Food is always cooked well and served promptly

First off the exterior lights are off to discourage customers. We got here at 10:20, it's listed as closing at 11:30. First let me say that the server Rachel is awesome!!! She saw we were not happy and did her absolute best to accommodate us and make us happy! Bartender is talking crap out loud. The only customers are my group of 3 and another group of 5. My fiancee's patron margarita glass has a chip in it. I turn it in, he pours a well margarita and hands it back with no salt. I ask for it, his response was I just emptied it. Seriously. Rachel the server thankfully repoured the drink and salted the rim. Thankful for the little things. Food was served promptly, and was Ok. Just average really. If not for Rachel, we would have walked out.
There food has gotten better, the spicy chicken sandwich big and very good. I like to get asparagus instead of the fries. Delicious salads too. Lunch prices are comparable to everyone else.

Disappointment is the word that comes to mind,  I entered this chili's about 12:15 pm. There was no hostess, and actually no servers. I assumed they were in a meeting, so I seated myself in the bar. Twelve minutes later - still no one. Finally, a server appeared and due to the time restrictions, I changed my order to the chips, soup, and salad.  The chips arrived in a timely manner, as did the soup and salad. However, after waiting with empty plates for 10 minutes I decided to cash out and leave. The food was good but the service fell so far below the standard I changed from three-star to two stars. I'm afraid this Chili's will be closed unless the personnel begin looking at caring for guests in a better manner.

Had a great experience here last Sunday lunch. We don't have one super close to us so we took advantage while visiting my inlaws. The food was fast, hot, and tasty. Our server was very courteous and professional. Perhaps my memory of places like Chili's, TGI Friday's, and Applebee's is romanticized from me teens when lunch or dinner at either of them would have been a treat. My recent experiences couldn't have been bummers. However, this Chili's took me back to those happy days. Great job!
